array.string: Amok trey also known as amok trei or fish amok, literally meaning 'steam cooked fish'. It involves fish being coated in coconut milk with kroeung and steamed in banana leaves.
In a traditional bandeja paisa: red beans cooked with pork, white rice, ground meat, chicharrón, fried egg, plantain, chorizo, arepa, hogao sauce, morcilla, avocado and lemon.
Banku is cooked by a proportionate mixture of fermented corn and cassava dough in hot water into a smooth, whitish paste, served with soup, stew or a pepper sauce with fish.
Bobotie is a well-known dish consisting of spiced minced meat baked with an egg-based topping.
Cachupa is a slow cooked stew of corn, beans, cassava, sweet potato, fish or meat, and often morcela. Referred to as the country's national dish, each island has its own regional variation.
Chivito is a thin slice of tender cooked beef steak, with mozzarella, tomatoes, mayonnaise, black or green olives, and commonly also bacon, fried or hard-boiled eggs and ham.
Doner kebab is made of meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie. Seasoned meat stacked in the shape of an inverted cone is turned slowly on the rotisserie, next to a vertical cooking element.
Doubles is a common street food. Doubles are made with two baras (flat fried dough) and filled with curry channa (curried chickpeas) and various chutneys.
Ducks bred. The meat is often eaten with spring onion, cucumber and sweet bean sauce with pancakes rolled around the fillings.

Ema datshi is recognized as made from chili peppers and cheese; "ema" means "chili" and "datshi" means "cheese". Different varieties of chilies may be used: green chili, red chili, and/or white chili.
Ful medames is a stew of cooked fava beans served with vegetable oil, cumin with chopped parsley, garlic, onion, lemon juice, chili pepper and other vegetable, herb and spice ingredients.

A hamburger is a sandwich consisting of one or more cooked patties of ground meat, usually beef, placed inside a sliced bread roll or bun. The patty may be pan fried, grilled, smoked or flame broiled.
Khachapuri is a dish of cheese-filled bread. The bread is leavened, usually with cheese in the middle and a crust which is ripped off and used to dip in the cheese.
Mixed grill consists of chicken hearts, spleens and liver mixed with bits of lamb cooked on a flat grill, seasoned with onion, garlic, black pepper, cumin, turmeric, olive oil and coriander.
Moules-frites is a main dish of mussels and fries. Ingredients: extra-virgin olive oil, shallots, garlic, white wine, Kosher salt and freshly cracked black pepper, mussels, creme fraiche and etc.
Ndolé is a dish consisting of stewed nuts, bitter leaves and fish or beef. The dish may also contain shrimp or prawns. It is traditionally eaten with plantain, bobolo.
Pabellón criollo is a traditional dish, the local version of the rice and beans combination. It is a plate of rice, shredded beef in stew and stewed black beans.
Pastel de choclo is a dish based on sweetcorn or choclo. The filling usually contains ground beef, chicken, raisins, black olives, onions or slices of hard boiled egg.
Pelmeni are dumplings that consist of a filling wrapped in thin, unleavened dough.
Pizza consists of a usually round, flattened base of leavened wheat-based dough topped with tomatoes, cheese, and often various other ingredients baked at a high temperature.
Pot-au-feu ("pot on the fire") is a beef stew. According to the chef Raymond Blanc, pot-au-feu is "the quintessence of family cuisine; it is the most celebrated dish.
Quzi also called qoozi or ghozi is a rice based dish popular in the Arab states of the Persian Gulf. It is served with very slow cooked lamb, roasted nuts, raisins and served over rice.
Rösti or rööschti is a dish consisting mainly of potatoes, in the style of a fritter. It is served to accompany other dishes such as Spinat und Spiegelei, cervelas or Fleischkäse.
Saleeg is a white-rice dish, cooked with broth (chicken or other meat) and milk. Some people say that it tastes like the Italian risotto. It is usually eaten during traditional celebrations.
Stollen is a fruit bread of nuts, spices, and dried or candied fruit, coated with powdered sugar or icing sugar. It is a traditional bread eaten during the Christmas season.
Sushi is a dish of prepared vinegared rice , usually with some sugar and salt, accompanying a variety of ingredients, such as seafood, vegetables, and occasionally tropical fruits.

Svíčková is a meat dish . It is sirloin steak prepared with vegetables (carrots, parsley root, celeriac and onion), spiced with black pepper, allspice, bay leaf and thyme, and boiled with double cream.
Tavë kosi ("soured milk casserole") is a dish of lamb and rice baked with a mixture of yogurt and eggs (replacing the original soured milk) added to a roux.
Tiep or thieb is a traditional dish. Meat and additional ingredients often include onions, carrots, cabbage, cassava, hot pepper, lime and peanut oil, and Maggi cubes.
Tortilla de patatas is an omelette made with eggs and potatoes, optionally including onion. It is often served at room temperature as a tapa.
